how.far.is.it 0.0.0.9000

    • How far is it use case

    How far is it use case

    aa-exploration.Rmd
    library(how.far.is.it)

    Data needed

    We need an address and a token in order to call the API.

    The address we get by simply setting it like this:

    address <- "Amager Boulevard 126, 2300 København S"

    The token is a bit more tricky. You need to go to http://hvorlangterder.dk using Chrome or Firefox, right click inspect and see the XHR calls under Network. Here you should see some API calls being made. They look like this:

    https://hvorlangterder.poi.viamap.net/v1/nearestpoi/?poitypes=coast&fromaddress=Amager%20Boulevard%20124,%202300%20K%C3%B8benhavn%20S&mot=foot&token=eyJkcGZ4IjogImh2b3JsYW5ndGVyZGVyIiwgInByaXZzIjogInIxWjByMEYwazZCdFdxUWNPVXlrQi95NlNVcEp2MlFiZ3lYZXRxNEhZNFhPLzNZclcwK0s5dz09In0.fP4JWis69HmaSg5jVHiK8nemiCu6VaMULSGGJyK4D4PkWq4iA1+nSHWMaHxepKwJ83sEiy9nMNZhv7BcktRNrA

    Grap the token part and set it as token

    token <- "eyJkcGZ4IjogImh2b3JsYW5ndGVyZGVyIiwgInByaXZzIjogInIxWjByMEYwazZCdFdxUWNPVXlrQi95NlNVcEp2MlFiZ3lYZXRxNEhZNFhPLzNZclcwK0s5dz09In0.fP4JWis69HmaSg5jVHiK8nemiCu6VaMULSGGJyK4D4PkWq4iA1+nSHWMaHxepKwJ83sEiy9nMNZhv7BcktRNrA"

    Get the distance

    Now you are ready to get the distance.

    how_far_df <- how_far_is_it(address, token)

    Let us have a look at the data:

    dplyr::glimpse(how_far_df)
#> Observations: 20
#> Variables: 12
#> $ poi_id           <int> 3260383, 153861, 3247612, 269388, 133794, 32302…
#> $ type             <chr> "daycare", "doctor", "hospital", "junction", "m…
#> $ name             <chr> "Københavns Kommunes Ungdomsskole Amager 10", "…
#> $ from_lat         <dbl> 55.66583, 55.66583, 55.66583, 55.66583, 55.6658…
#> $ from_lng         <dbl> 12.59705, 12.59705, 12.59705, 12.59705, 12.5970…
#> $ travel_seconds   <dbl> 399.1104, 3258.3672, 3336.8760, 230.6880, 393.9…
#> $ mot              <chr> "foot", "foot", "foot", "foot", "foot", "foot",…
#> $ route_polyline   <chr> "ggwrIck{kAPkAr@qEL{@LcAF]Fi@DGt@s@RShAgAKg@[cC…
#> $ euclidean_meters <dbl> 438.78, 4066.81, 4132.28, 237.52, 463.34, 85.96…
#> $ to_lat           <dbl> 55.66520, 55.62948, 55.62960, 55.66447, 55.6633…
#> $ to_lng           <dbl> 12.60394, 12.60337, 12.61127, 12.59415, 12.6029…
#> $ routed_meters    <dbl> 554.32, 4525.51, 4634.55, 320.40, 547.14, 169.2…

    As you can see we now have a data set detailing distances to different points of interest.

    Create distance features

    We can then turn this tibble into a list of distance features for the address like this.

    how_far_features <- create_distance_features(how_far_df)

    Let us have a look at the newly created features:

    dplyr::glimpse(how_far_features)
#> Observations: 1
#> Variables: 60
#> $ airport_euclidean_meters     <dbl> 436.58
#> $ airport_routed_meters        <dbl> 552.43
#> $ airport_travel_seconds       <dbl> 397.7496
#> $ coast_euclidean_meters       <dbl> 2127.23
#> $ coast_routed_meters          <dbl> 2335.98
#> $ coast_travel_seconds         <dbl> 1681.906
#> $ daycare_euclidean_meters     <dbl> 438.78
#> $ daycare_routed_meters        <dbl> 554.32
#> $ daycare_travel_seconds       <dbl> 399.1104
#> $ doctor_euclidean_meters      <dbl> 4066.81
#> $ doctor_routed_meters         <dbl> 4525.51
#> $ doctor_travel_seconds        <dbl> 3258.367
#> $ forest_euclidean_meters      <dbl> 5224.76
#> $ forest_routed_meters         <dbl> 6045.63
#> $ forest_travel_seconds        <dbl> 4352.854
#> $ hospital_euclidean_meters    <dbl> 4132.28
#> $ hospital_routed_meters       <dbl> 4634.55

#> $ lake_routed_meters           <dbl> 2335.98
#> $ lake_travel_seconds          <dbl> 1681.906

#> $ library_routed_meters        <dbl> 212.9
#> $ library_travel_seconds       <dbl> 153.288
#> $ metro_euclidean_meters       <dbl> 463.34
#> $ metro_routed_meters          <dbl> 547.14
#> $ metro_travel_seconds         <dbl> 393.9408
#> $ pharmacy_euclidean_meters    <dbl> 569.96
#> $ pharmacy_routed_meters       <dbl> 666.48
#> $ pharmacy_travel_seconds      <dbl> 479.8656
#> $ publicbath_euclidean_meters  <dbl> 834.66
#> $ publicbath_routed_meters     <dbl> 948.59

#> $ roadtrain_routed_meters      <dbl> 5444.19
#> $ roadtrain_travel_seconds     <dbl> 3919.817

#> $ school_routed_meters         <dbl> 169.26

#> $ soccerfield_routed_meters    <dbl> 1508.38
#> $ soccerfield_travel_seconds   <dbl> 1086.034
#> $ sportshall_euclidean_meters  <dbl> 865.8

#> $ sportshall_travel_seconds    <dbl> 788.2992
#> $ stop_euclidean_meters        <dbl> 875.32
#> $ stop_routed_meters           <dbl> 1012.3
#> $ stop_travel_seconds          <dbl> 728.856
#> $ strain_euclidean_meters      <dbl> 1829.22
#> $ strain_routed_meters         <dbl> 2150.61
#> $ strain_travel_seconds        <dbl> 1548.439
#> $ supermarket_euclidean_meters <dbl> 56.73
#> $ supermarket_routed_meters    <dbl> 70.33
#> $ supermarket_travel_seconds   <dbl> 50.6376
#> $ train_euclidean_meters       <dbl> 360.4
#> $ train_routed_meters          <dbl> 485.8
#> $ train_travel_seconds         <dbl> 349.776

    A very nice data set that now contains 60 distance features for the given address.
